body_content.explanation: an exam in several subjects taken in the last year of school around the age of 18 in France and some other countries:
examples: I was studying for my baccalaureate and hoping to go to university.
She argues in favour of moving to a baccalaureate system, where students are able to take a wider range of subjects rather than specializing at 16.

body_content.explanation: a bachelor's degree (= a first degree at college or university):
examples: Students can opt for a two-year associate degree or a four-year baccalaureate.
Getting a baccalaureate degree has often been seen as the route to well-paid employment.
